channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Ukrainians worry about being excluded from negotiations over ending the war
item.description: President Trump says he is willing to meet with Vladimir Putin to discuss an end to the war in Ukraine, without requiring the Russian leader to also meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Israel announces plan to take over Gaza City, the political battle over redrawing congressional maps continues to escalate, Trump wants a new U.S. census to exclude people living in the country without legal status.

item.title: What the implications of a new census could be
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks with John Bisognano, president of the National Democratic Redistricting Committee, about efforts to remap congressional districts, and what President Trump's proposed new census could mean.

item.title: In Josh Brolin's new film, 'Weapons', 17 school children vanish
item.description: In the film "Weapons," 17 elementary school children vanish. A teacher is blamed. Parents are mystified. NPR's A Martinez talks with actor Josh Brolin about playing the father of one of the missing kids.

item.title: Trump is trying to rewrite the history of the 2021 attack on the U.S. Capitol
item.description: President Trump has tried to rewrite the history of the Jan. 6, 2021 attack on the U.S. Capitol. In the latest example, the Department of Justice hired a former Jan. 6 defendant who urged rioters to "kill" police.

item.title: How Trump's tariffs are bringing in new revenue, and how it will be spent
item.description: President Trump's new tariffs are pouring revenue into the United States' coffers. We put that in context with overall tax revenue, and Trump's spending plans.

item.title: Trump opens the door for private equity in retirement plans
item.description: An executive order from President Trump would extend the opportunity for 401k fund managers to include private equity in retirement portfolios. What are the risks and benefits?

item.title: Radio Free Europe journalists in Latvia face an uncertain future
item.description: Russian journalists in exile fight Russian propaganda, working for U.S.-funded Radio Free Europe from Latvia. But the Trump administration plans to cut funds is creating uncertainty.

item.title: Israel announces plan to take over Gaza City
item.description: Israel's Security Cabinet approved a proposal early Friday for the military to expand the war in Gaza and take control of Gaza City, one of the last areas of the territory not yet under full military occupation.

item.title: A former State Department negotiator on the risks of Israel's take over of Gaza
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Aaron David Miller, a former State Department Middle East analyst and negotiator, about the risks that come with Israel's decision to further occupy Gaza.
